title: Subscription Box Boom
text:
October 21, 2015, 10:10 PM by Angela Kennecke SIOUX FALLS, SD - 
Whether it's offbeat---like supplies to prepare for Doomsday or Japanese Candy; or more mundane---like clothes or beauty items--you can bet there's a box for it. 
Ranging from about $10 to $50 or more, monthly subscription boxes are the latest shopping craze. 
Megan Bartel can't wait to dig into her Stitch Fix box when it arrives. 
"It's kind of fun because you get a package of five items--and you have no idea what it's going to be and you get really excited because you have someone else shopping for you and it's like Christmas, being able to open up a package that's handpicked for you," Bartel said. 
Bartel heard about the clothing subscription box Stitch Fix through a friend and signed up three months ago. 
"With Stitch Fix, it's a $20 fee and they call it a styling fee and you only get charged the $20 if you don't pick anything," Bartel said. 
If she does buy something, her $20 goes toward her purchase. She has to send everything back in a prepaid envelope within three days or she'll get charged for all of it. 
"I feel like I'm gearing more toward online shopping than I am in the store because as a parent you're busy and you don't have a lot of time to go try on clothes so these things have really worked with our lifestyle," Bartel said. 
Bartel takes pictures of what she gets in each box and writes up a review on her Facebook page. When her friends sign up, she gets a discount. You can check out reviews on all kinds of subscription boxes at MySubcriptionAddition.com . Liz Cadmen started it in 2012 after signing up for beauty samples through BirchBox. 
"And the most popular boxes do deliver a value that's at least double what you paid. And then of course the other thing is will you actually use those items yourself, because if it's something you won't use, even if it's a high value item, it's not a good value for you," Cadmen said. 
Cadmen lists more than 1,400 boxes with another five added to the site every week. She says you'll get the best deal if you sign up for six or 12 months upfront. Cadmen says it's also best to sign up using PayPal if possible. 
"You can cancel all your subscriptions through your Pay Pal account. You don't have to call in or go through any other type of hassle that some boxes may have to make you cancel," Cadmen said. 
Don't like something in your box? MySubcriptionAddiction.com even offers a page where you can swap items with someone else. And expect to see some good deals on subscriptions coming up on Black Friday and Cyber Monday. 
Some new boxes are also gaining in popularity are those filled with comics and toys, home décor and books. © 2015 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
